page.title: 12Bottle Bank at Newnham Rd
page.content: The bottle bank is a dome shaped container about 2 metres high where people can put their empty glass bottles when they have finished using them. The glass is collected regularly and recycled to make more bottles and jars. 50% of local councils have a bottle bank scheme and the first one was started in August 1977. Nearly 3,000,000 bottles are saved at bottle banks every week-Prince Charles was so keen on the idea that he arranged for one to be sited at Buckingham Palace! It takes approximately 3,500 bottles to make 1 tonne of glass and every tonne of glass saves the energy equivalent of 30 gallons of oil. Since 1977 the equivalent of 10 million gallons of oil has been saved. The bank at Newnham is sited well away from any houses as the the smashing of bottles makes a lot of noise.
